newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland's Solidarity alliance to unveil programme.
newsitem.headline: Poland's Solidarity alliance to unveil programme.

text.p: Poland's Solidarity-led alliance of right-wing parties will unveil its programme and present its parliamentary candidates at a convention to be held in May or June, a spokesman said on Sunday.
"At our national convention, the Solidarity Election Action (AWS) will present its programme and its Sejm (lower house) and Senate candidates," PAP news agency quoted Piotr Zak as saying.
"It will be preceded by regional conventions in which the members of all organisations comprising the AWS may participate," he added.

The AWS was set up last June by the Solidarity trade union as a broad coalition of some two dozen centre-right and rightist parties to defeat the ex-communist-led coalition that has ruled Poland since 1993.
A recent public opinion poll showed that the AWS had a good chance of winning the elections, due to be held in September.
The AWS enjoyed the support of 29 percent of those surveyed, compared with 25 percent for the ex-communist Democratic Left Alliance.
